intro: Thelysia planifolia, commonly known as the flatleaf thrysia, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Thelysia planifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and relatively rare member of its family.
